PAD_MintharaReaction.synopsis: When dialogue with Balthazar ends (or his projection that delivers the narrative bit) this PAD is played by Minthara in party.

AD_EnemyVulnerable.synopsis: Balthazar orders his flesh golem to attack his enemy while they're vulnerable
AD_EnemyVulnerable.how_to_trigger: One of Balthazar's opponents has the Hold Person or Paralyze status

AD_OrderingGhouls.synopsis: Balthazar gives some orders to his ghouls while in the Shar temple. He tells them to fetch things related to his necromancy (he's busy repairing some of his undead troops)
AD_OrderingGhouls.how_to_trigger: Observe Balthaxar in his sanctum after SHA_Necromnacer_Chosen. Triggers automatically

AD_StartTurn.synopsis: Balthazar gloats at and taunts the player before acting during his turn

AD_GolemDead.synopsis: Balthazar is angry at his flesh golem being killed
AD_GolemDead.how_to_trigger: Kill Balthazar's flesh golem during combat

Chosen.synopsis: The player meets Balthazar, the necromancer, in his temporary command centre in the Shar temple. They find him at an altar, repairing one of his damaged undead, while other minions bustle around. Balthazar has been sent by Ketheric Thorm to recover Nightsong, but has been unable to clear a path to her vault. He decides to recruit the player, upon recognising them as tadpoled. The player can agree or decline, and can possibly persuade him to loan his flesh golem to aid their exploration.
Chosen.how_to_trigger: goto -828; 8; -784 fight the shadowquakesthe door to baltazar is now open. Approach and talk to him.

GolemInvitation.synopsis: Balthazar's private chambers are unlocked and his flesh golem invites the players inside to talk
GolemInvitation.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically when the players defeat the Dark Justiciars that attack Balthazar's hideout in Shar Temple

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.synopsis: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars

AD_Death.synopsis: Balthazar's final words as he dies

Barricade.synopsis: The player is challenged by some skeleton warriors at a barricade outside the Necromancer's lair. The necromancer speaks through the dead warriors - his words in their dessicated voices.(this mayor may not follow on from an earlier scene with more skeletons controlled by the necromancer). A mindmeld convinces the necromancer to command his skeletons to grant entry. The scene ends with combat with the skeletons, or a shadowquake triggering a fight between player (+ skeletons) against sharran wraiths. Afterwards, the player is invited into Balthazar's inner sanctum.
Barricade.how_to_trigger: Being spotted by the skeletons at the entrance to Balthazar's hideout near X: -800 Y: -787 in the Shar Temple

AD_BarricadeLeader.synopsis: The lead skeleton defending Balthazar's room will attempt to grab the players' attention
AD_BarricadeLeader.how_to_trigger: Approach the skeletons guarding Balthazar's room without getting close enough to start the main cinematic dialog

AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts.synopsis: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_1.synopsis: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars

PAD_DefeatedNecro.synopsis: The players comment on Balthazar's death

AD_OutsideRoom.synopsis: Balthazar has left his room, and Nightsong's prison is still locked. He won't speak to palyers outside the safety of his room
AD_OutsideRoom.how_to_trigger: Lure Balthazar outside of his room trigger - S_SHA_Necromancer_Lair_186344d1-746d-424e-8822-2c29179ab34c

FleshGolem.synopsis: Short dialog where the player can interact with Balthazar's flesh golem. Incapable of speech, it utters a moaning sound.

AD_DominateGolem.synopsis: Balthazar scolds his flesh golem as he calms it down

AD_LowHP.synopsis: Balthazar defiantly reacts to being critically injured

AD_GhoulSnarl.synopsis: One of the necromancer's ghoul servants barks a short, guttural warning if the player gets too close.
AD_GhoulSnarl.how_to_trigger: Move too close to one of Balthazar's ghouls in his sanctum

Skeletons.synopsis: A one-liner for the Necromancer's skeletons. Used after shadowquake fight has concluded. If the player hasn't yet spoken to the necromancer in person, they're directed to see him. Otherwise, they're told to not bother the skeletons. The necromancer is in fact controlling the skeletons and speaking through them here.
Skeletons.how_to_trigger: After fight with ghost dark justiciars in library (around -717; -816)

NecroInvitation.synopsis: After fighting off the Dark Justiciar attack on Balthazar's hideout in the Shar Temple, the players are invited to his personal quarters to speak properly
NecroInvitation.how_to_trigger: Triggered automatically after the player defeats the Dark Justiciars, if Balthazar was pulled into the previous combat against the Dark Justiciars

AD_GolemGoesBerserk.synopsis: Balthazar is angry that the player made his golem go berserk
AD_GolemGoesBerserk.how_to_trigger: Balthazar's flesh golem casts Shout_Berserk_FleshGolem during combat

PAD_MintharaReaction_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PAD_MintharaReaction_0.text: I wish I could kill that bloated sack of offal, but he may yet help us reach Ketheric.

AD_EnemyVulnerable_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_EnemyVulnerable_0.text: We have the upper hand - do your work, Flesh!

AD_OrderingGhouls_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls_0.text: Embalming fluid, and a pipette. Now.
AD_OrderingGhouls_0.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_OrderingGhouls_3.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls_3.text: Bring me a liver - and I don't want to see any bite marks on it!
AD_OrderingGhouls_3.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_OrderingGhouls_4.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls_4.text: Bring me a femur bone - a good one, not the one with the marrow pox.
AD_OrderingGhouls_4.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_OrderingGhouls_5.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls_5.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_StartTurn_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn_0.text: It will be a kindness to put an end to your follies.

AD_StartTurn_1.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn_1.text: You shall live to regret this. Perhaps not for long.

AD_StartTurn_2.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn_2.text: Let us make short work of this.

Chosen_27.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_27.text: Ah, the interloper - and in one piece as well. Not an entirely unpromising specimen, for one naturally-born.
Chosen_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar looks up from an altar repurposed as a surgical table of sorts. One of his undead warriors, damaged, lies upon it.NodeContext: Begrudging and largely hostile, but with a hint of appreciation for the player's skill in actually making it this far.

Chosen_83.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_83.text: Not just any True Soul would have succeeded in following my path through this place. You should be pleased.

Chosen_43.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_43.text: Though it's not all natural, is it? A touch of the divine... Most curious, for a True Soul.

Chosen_54.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_54.text: I take it the breaking of my skeletons was an accident - the living are so clumsy, after all.

Chosen_149.speaker: Player
Chosen_149.text: I'm pleased to be of service, Balthazar.

Chosen_194.speaker: Player
Chosen_194.text: Another True Soul was looking for you. Nere - I aided him in the Underdark.

Chosen_17.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_17.text: Ah, it was you who pulled his sorry carcass from the rubble. You should have left him there.

Chosen_273.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_273.text: The miserable worm tried to kill me, hoping to take all the glory of this mission for himself.

Chosen_143.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_143.text: Dull, dull, dull. Nere was never cut out to be a True Soul - he's a very obedient corpse, though.

Chosen_258.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_258.text: Perhaps you can prove to me that you're more useful alive than dead. You know what's at stake here, I take it?

Chosen_197.speaker: Player
Chosen_197.text: Balthazar, I presume? Z'rell sent me. She thinks you're in danger of failing your master.
Chosen_197.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player received the Balthazar quest from Z'rell

Chosen_204.speaker: Player
Chosen_204.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player didn't receive  the Balthazar quest from Z'rell

Chosen_255.speaker: Player
Chosen_255.text: I fought a battle right under your nose - help would have been useful.

Chosen_226.speaker: Player
Chosen_226.text: I fought a battle right under your nose - whoever you are, some help would have been useful.

Chosen_67.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_67.text: Do you truly expect your betters to sully their hands to aid you at every turn, True Soul? Such a poor grasp of hierarchy...

Chosen_178.speaker: Player
Chosen_178.text: True Soul? Bold of you, to assume I'm a comrade.

Chosen_154.speaker: Player
Chosen_154.text: Bold of you to assume I didn't destroy your skeletons deliberately.

Chosen_78.speaker: Player
Chosen_78.text: Naturally-born? That's a strange thing to hold against someone.

Chosen_33.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_33.text: Not so. Womb births are such imprecise things... There's always room for improvement when it comes to the flesh.

Chosen_170.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_170.text: My creations are more than a sum of their parts.

Chosen_26.speaker: Player
Chosen_26.text: Enough unpleasantries. You're Balthazar, yes? Z'rell sent me, to ensure you didn't fail your master.

Chosen_114.speaker: Player
Chosen_114.text: Your creations? Mindless undead minions, from what I've seen.

Chosen_270.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_270.text: They are mere sketches compared to my masterwork - that would leave you in awe, should you be fortunate enough to bear witness.

Chosen_222.speaker: Player
Chosen_222.text: You're assuming I'm an ally. Unwise, perhaps.

Chosen_175.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_175.text: Is it? I've seen inside your head, thanks to my troops. Besides, if you were an enemy, you'd be completely surrounded.

Chosen_91.speaker: Player
Chosen_91.text: I'm friendly. Z'rell sent me to make sure you weren't failing your master.
Chosen_91.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows of Balthazar from Z'rell

Chosen_131.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_131.text: Rubbish. Everything is at hand here - Z'rell merely envies the General's faith in me. I am in the midst of a grand strategy.

Chosen_202.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_202.text: But you're here now, and I may be able to put those limbs to work. You know what's at stake here, I take it?

Chosen_51.speaker: Player
Chosen_51.text: Nere mentioned that you were seeking access to the Temple. Looks like you found it.

Chosen_122.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_122.text: Perhaps you'd be more useful dead than alive if you don't even know what I'm seeking here.

Chosen_218.speaker: Player
Chosen_218.text: Z'rell spoke of a relic - something called the Nightsong in your notes. They were very interesting.

Chosen_121.speaker: Player
Chosen_121.text: Something called the Nightsong. Your notes were very interesting.
Chosen_121.context: InternalNodeContext: |Flag Needed|  for searching Balthazar's MRT quarters

Chosen_229.speaker: Player
Chosen_229.text: Z'rell said Ketheric wants you to find a relic. That's all I know.

Chosen_71.speaker: Player
Chosen_71.text: Judging by how you're cowering in here, your survival?

Chosen_263.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_263.text: I do not cower - I plan. I command. I create.

Chosen_253.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_253.text: General Thorm trusts me. He knows I will deliver. He knows I will stand by him long after all others wilt and fall.

Chosen_37.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_37.text: You, Z'rell, all the rest... you have only one body with which to serve. I have as many as I care to make.

Chosen_31.speaker: Player
Chosen_31.text: Yet you seem no closer to retrieving the Nightsong? I read your notes - very interesting.
Chosen_31.context: InternalNodeContext: |Flag Needed|  for searching Balthazar's MRT quarters

Chosen_97.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_97.text: Interesting, and private. Give me one reason why I shouldn't have my creations kill you right now, thief.

Chosen_68.speaker: Player
Chosen_68.text: I had Z'rell's permission - that good enough for you?
Chosen_68.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if Z'rell briefed the player and they had instructions to look in Balthazar's room in Moonrise

Chosen_162.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_162.text: Z'rell exceeds her authority. But fine, I'll overlook your transgressions this time - there are much grander things at stake.

Chosen_73.speaker: Player
Chosen_73.text: I received permission. Take it up with your peers at Moonrise, if you have an issue.
Chosen_73.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player did not have instructions to look in Balthazar's room in Moonrise

Chosen_264.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_264.text: Liar. Liar and a waste of flesh. I'll see what I can salvage from you, after my creations are through with you.
Chosen_264.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced, furious. Combat ensues afterwards

Chosen_15.speaker: Player
Chosen_15.text: Because I'll rip your tongue out, shove it down your throat, then stomp on your 'creations' until they are dirt beneath my feet.

Chosen_96.speaker: Player
Chosen_96.text: Touch me, and I'll strike you down with all of nature's fang and fury. Go ahead - try me.

Chosen_210.speaker: Player
Chosen_210.text: I wield the divine. I can use it to assist you, or send you screaming to the Fugue Plane. Your choice.

Chosen_25.speaker: Player
Chosen_25.text: Do it - unleash your creations. But they will not protect you from me - or my righteous fury.

Chosen_216.speaker: Player
Chosen_216.text: You're hiding from shadows - literally. Don't make threats you can't back up.

Chosen_21.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_21.text: ...Fine. I'll forgive your transgressions this time - there are much grander things at stake.
Chosen_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Squints at the player, considering, before speaking.NodeContext: A pause before 'fine' - weighing up the player's fate.

Chosen_129.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_129.text: The Nightsong is my finest creation - if I never exceed myself, I will still die happy. Not that I ever intend to do something as gauche as truly dying, of course.
Chosen_129.context: NodeContext: Peeved at the intrusion, but also proud of his work

Chosen_8.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_8.text: Now, given your prying nature, I have work for you, as a scout.
Chosen_8.context: NodeContext: First sentence: dreamily waxing lyrcial about Nightsong. Second sentence: down to business.

Chosen_99.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_99.text: The Nightsong lends the General his strength, his invulnerability. It must be recovered, before his enemies attempt to exploit it.

Chosen_80.speaker: Player
Chosen_80.text: Sounds like you've good reason to be proud of the Nightsong - tell me more.

Chosen_243.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_243.text: And spoil the surprise? I think not. But let's just say that the Nightsong was a unique specimen even before I began my work...

Chosen_7.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_7.text: Words - even my words - are woefully insufficient. When you see for yourself, you will understand.

Chosen_28.speaker: Player
Chosen_28.text: What do you need me to do?

Chosen_182.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_182.text: I do not need you, or your help. But you are here in spite of that, so I may as well make use of you.

Chosen_213.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_213.text: The Nightsong is close, but the way is barred and Shar's dead are... uncooperative. Clear the path for me - by blade, cunning, or whatever it takes.
Chosen_213.context: InternalNodeContext: Searched Balthazar's MRT quarters/mentioned Nightsong

Chosen_24.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_24.text: The relic is close, but the way is barred and Shar's dead are... uncooperative. Clear the path for me - by blade, cunning, or whatever it takes.

Chosen_268.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_268.text: I will remain here until you have succeeded, or fallen.

Chosen_137.speaker: Shadowheart
Chosen_137.text: I'd trust this gasbag about as far as I can throw him - which isn't far. But perhaps better to play along, for now.

Chosen_262.speaker: Player
Chosen_262.text: You have resources to spare - give me something to aid my search.

Chosen_79.speaker: Player
Chosen_79.text: For jobs like this it's good form to provide your operatives some extra resources.

Chosen_265.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_265.text: Fine. I will assign Flesh to aid you on your way. Ring this bell...
Chosen_265.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind his back for the bell

Chosen_85.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar holds up a small bell  and gives it a short ring. The flesh golem looks at it and gurgles with interest.

Chosen_173.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_173.text: My brother is no intellectual powerhouse, but he is strong, loyal and punctual. Should a fight turn against you, remember the bell.

Chosen_101.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_101.text: Flesh will remain here until called. Don't fear, he has very sharp hearing - I chose his ears myself. Now, get to work.

Chosen_190.speaker: Player
Chosen_190.text: Wait. It - he - is your brother?

Chosen_125.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_125.text: In part, yes - my poor unborn twin. Mother always resented me for it - said I strangled him in the womb, if you can believe such tripe.

Chosen_134.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_134.text: Besides, once I developed my powers, I fetched him from the graveyard and brought him back - gave him a new, better body. Alas, mother was... not pleased.

Chosen_98.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_98.text: We're still close. She's in a jar on the shelf over there.
Chosen_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cannot include shot of the jar - we cannot guarantee that it is still on the shelf

Chosen_92.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_92.text: What the...? Give me back my mother, this instant!
Chosen_92.context: NodeContext: Briefly confused, then angry (player has taken the jar containing parts of his dead mother)

Chosen_188.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_188.text: Good. And keep your hands to yourself in future.
Chosen_188.context: CinematicNodeContext: Item transfer gestureNodeContext: Cooling down (player has returned the jar containing his dead mother)

Chosen_59.speaker: Player
Chosen_59.text: No, I think I'll keep her.

Chosen_195.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_195.text: I gave you a chance, mother-thief!

Chosen_64.speaker: Player
Chosen_64.text: What exactly will you be doing while I'm out risking myself?
Chosen_64.context: InternalNodeContext: Question only available if the player hasn't yet agreed to help (for hasmet flow)

Chosen_151.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_151.text: My creations need tending to - not that it's any of your concern.

Chosen_44.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_44.text: This one's broken. He once tormented me as a youth, lifetimes ago. Now he serves me, forever.
Chosen_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smiling fondly down at the damaged skeleton on the altarNodeContext: 'This guy used to pick on me. Now look at him'

Chosen_66.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_66.text: No rest for you yet, Mikan. You will serve me until I am satisfied.
Chosen_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leans down, whispers the line to the damaged skeleton, then straightens back upNodeContext: Whispered taunt. Mick-an

Chosen_29.speaker: Player
Chosen_29.text: Keep it - this is your problem, not mine.

Chosen_100.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_100.text: Go, then - you'll either come to your senses, or die in this place without me.

Chosen_234.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_234.text: This is not a problem - it is an opportunity. And it is not a choice either - you will obey.

Chosen_224.speaker: Player
Chosen_224.text: Fine. I'll see what I can do.

Chosen_230.speaker: Player
Chosen_230.text: There's always a choice. Like I can let you live, or not.

Chosen_274.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_274.text: Go, then. You'll be back, once you've had another taste of Shar's hospitality.

Chosen_152.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_152.text: You will obey - once you are reborn as one of my creations.

Chosen_181.speaker: Player
Chosen_181.text: Obey? No - I will smite you where you stand, necromancer.

Chosen_4.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_4.text: Fine. I will assign Flesh to aid you on your way. Ring this bell...
Chosen_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind his back for the bell

Chosen_32.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_32.text: ...Hmm. Misplaced, it seems. You will be capable enough without it.

Chosen_141.speaker: Player
Chosen_141.text: I'll see what I can do.

Chosen_120.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_120.text: Do not fail me, or you can share in Mikan's fate.
Chosen_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at the broken skeleton on the altar beside himInternalNodeContext: This node if the Necromancer referred to Mikan beforeNodeContext: Mick-an

Chosen_201.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_201.text: Do not fail me. If you do, you'll join the ranks of my creations, and be forced to try again.
Chosen_201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures at the broken skeleton on the altar beside himInternalNodeContext: This node if the Necromancer did not refer to Mikan before

Chosen_10.speaker: Player
Chosen_10.text: This sounds like your problem, not mine.

Chosen_172.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_172.text: I think not. You seem a capable type, and I'll need to keep myself well-protected in this place.

Chosen_82.speaker: Player
Chosen_82.text: About the orthon in these ruins - friend or foe to you?

Chosen_248.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_248.text: The devil is of no relevance to my goal. Besides, it seems you handled him well enough - I no longer hear that blasted singing of his.

Chosen_244.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_244.text: Perhaps I will seek out his carcass, should I be afforded the opportunity. Surely there are some parts I could put to use...

Chosen_247.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_247.text: Neither. That caterwauling beast is irrelevant as far as I'm concerned - unless he hampers my goals. In that case, consider him a foe, and act accordingly.

Chosen_133.speaker: Player
Chosen_133.text: Wrong - no part of you will remain here when I'm finished with you.

Chosen_203.speaker: Player
Chosen_203.text: I never said I was going to help. This is your problem.

Chosen_69.speaker: Player
Chosen_69.text: I think I'd rather exploit the Nightsong for myself - after I've gotten rid of you.

Chosen_177.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_177.text: Promising flesh wasted on an idiot mind, I see. I'll salvage what parts I can from you.

Chosen_146.speaker: Player
Chosen_146.text: I think I'd rather exploit this relic - after I've gotten rid of you.

Chosen_237.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_237.text: You are a waste of flesh. I'll see what I can salvage, after my creations are through with you.

Chosen_171.speaker: Player
Chosen_171.text: Sir, I am a jack-of-all-trades and a master of many. Our meeting was not by chance - you need me.

Chosen_267.speaker: Player
Chosen_267.text: You are a ship without a sail, necromancer. You need allies - you need me.

Chosen_242.speaker: Player
Chosen_242.text: Because I am magical powerhouse. You need me, and you know it.

Chosen_246.speaker: Player
Chosen_246.text: I outmatch you in both brains and magic - you need me.

Chosen_0.speaker: Player
Chosen_0.text: It's simple - you need me. Don't pretend otherwise.

Chosen_86.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_86.text: ...Fine. Your usefulness may outweigh your insolence - for now. There are much grander things at stake.
Chosen_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Squints at the player, considering, before speaking.NodeContext: A pause before 'fine' - weighing up the player's fate.

Chosen_113.speaker: Player
Chosen_113.text: As you mention serving Ketheric, he sent you to find a relic, no?

Chosen_168.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_168.text: General Thorm to you. But yes, recovering the relic is the crux of it. He commands, and I, his humble servant, fulfil that command.
Chosen_168.context: NodeContext: First sentence spoken as a reprimand, for not referring to Ketheric Thorm with due deferrence.

Chosen_11.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_11.text: While you, an infinitely more humble servant, fulfil my command. I will put you to work - as a scout.

Chosen_109.speaker: Narrator
Chosen_109.text: *This necromancer has Ketheric's trust. Helping him could be just what you need to gain access to the man himself.*

Chosen_212.speaker: Player
Chosen_212.text: So you need my help - what would I have to do?

Chosen_140.speaker: Player
Chosen_140.text: I need more to go on. Why is this relic so important? What does it do?

Chosen_5.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_5.text: Fine, if it'll spare me your bleating. The relic lends the General his strength, his invulnerability. It must be recovered, before his enemies attempt to exploit it.

Chosen_161.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_161.text: Telling you will not make the task any less perilous. Just obey, and use your ignorance as a shield. You should be adept at that already.

Chosen_225.speaker: Player
Chosen_225.text: Jobs like this always go smoother when I know exactly what I'm looking for.

Chosen_198.speaker: Player
Chosen_198.text: A scout is little good if they don't know what to look for. What does this relic do?

Chosen_250.speaker: Player
Chosen_250.text: What are the properties of this relic, magical or otherwise? So I can be of better assistance, of course.

Chosen_214.speaker: Player
Chosen_214.text: I'm not the type to make a deal without the details. What exactly am I looking for?

Chosen_42.speaker: Player
Chosen_42.text: As much as I enjoy you flattering me, this isn't my problem.

Chosen_232.speaker: Narrator
Chosen_232.text: *This necromancer has Ketheric's trust. Helping him might just be the best way to gain access to Moonrise Towers.*

Chosen_159.speaker: Player
Chosen_159.text: Fine, consider your merits acknowledged. Care to enlighten me as to what's going on?

Chosen_47.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_47.text: There is a relic here. One which General Thorm desires. No - needs. I will retrieve it for him...

Chosen_150.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_150.text: ...and you will help me. Ignorant you may be, you've shown some prowess in scouting and combat by making it this far.

Chosen_6.speaker: Player
Chosen_6.text: Interesting - let's test that theory. Time to die, monster.

Chosen_138.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_138.text: You and all the rest have only one body with which to serve. I have as many as I care to make.

Chosen_111.speaker: Player
Chosen_111.text: Balthazar - I heard of a monk by that name once. He died a long time ago.

Chosen_65.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_65.text: He didn't seem very legendary when I took his name - naught but a pile of bones. Impressive tomb, though.

Chosen_110.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_110.text: But enough idle chatter - keep to the matter at hand. You do know what's at stake here, yes?

Chosen_165.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_165.text: Oh, him? Yes, I decided to take his name for myself after taking his rib bones. Suits me better, I think.

Chosen_104.speaker: Player
Chosen_104.text: The name Balthazar seems familar, but not as a servant of Ketheric Thorm. Where have you heard it before?

Chosen_235.speaker: Narrator
Chosen_235.text: *It comes back to you - Balthazar headed a monastic order that controlled a place called Amkethran, in the deserts of Calimshan... but he is long dead, from what you recall.*

Chosen_19.speaker: Narrator
Chosen_19.text: *The thought eludes you. Perhaps you saw a passing reference in some old tome.*

Chosen_102.speaker: Player
Chosen_102.text: The name Balthazar seems vaguely familar, but from where?

Chosen_40.speaker: Player
Chosen_40.text: You're sure you've read of a notable Balthazar before... But where?

Chosen_116.speaker: Narrator
Chosen_116.text: *You remember an ancient scroll rescued from an Amkethran monastery. It spoke of Balthazar, the monastic order's leader. Specifically, it recorded his death.*

Chosen_252.speaker: Player
Chosen_252.text: Let's assume I'm friendly. Who are you?

Chosen_155.speaker: Player
Chosen_155.text: I could break you quicker than you could squeak an order. Talk - who are you?

Chosen_63.speaker: Player
Chosen_63.text: Doesn't matter - I've already mapped out five escape routes. But I'll bite - who are you?

Chosen_38.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_38.text: You are a True Soul - there is no excuse for you to not recognise your betters.

Chosen_238.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_238.text: But never mind, your potential may outweigh your ignorance. I am Balthazar - Chief Advisor to General Thorm, and entrusted with a mission of utmost importance.

Chosen_75.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_75.text: Do you know what is at stake here?

Chosen_164.speaker: Player
Chosen_164.text: I hunt and kill monsters - such threats mean nothing to me. Talk - who are you?

Chosen_189.speaker: Player
Chosen_189.text: You expect your words to spark fear - but I am past such things. Who are you?

Chosen_124.speaker: Player
Chosen_124.text: You didn't look deep enough. This will be your end, monster.

Chosen_187.speaker: Player
Chosen_187.text: Naturally-born? That's a strange thing to hold against someone.

Chosen_245.speaker: Player
Chosen_245.text: Naturally-born? I don't know if it's true, but that's a novel insult.

Chosen_126.speaker: Player
Chosen_126.text: Well, I'm not just a True Soul. I have some extraplanar help, so to speak.

Chosen_223.speaker: Player
Chosen_223.text: I'll be pleased when I separate your head from your shoulders, necromancer.

Chosen_186.speaker: Player
Chosen_186.text: You've fouled the name of mages long enough. I'll never let you leave this place alive, necromancer.

Chosen_145.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_145.text: Such a... limited grasp of mortality. Idiot.

Chosen_103.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_103.text: I said you'd be back. Reconsidered my proposition?

Chosen_211.speaker: Player
Chosen_211.text: Give me the bell. I'll see what I can do.

Chosen_56.speaker: Player
Chosen_56.text: All right, I'll help you find the Nightsong.
Chosen_56.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows about Nightsong via Balthazar's research and previously revealed this to the necormancer.

Chosen_12.speaker: Player
Chosen_12.text: All right, I'll help you find the Nightsong - and yes, I know more about this 'relic' than you realise.
Chosen_12.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player knows about Nightsong via Balthazar's research, but didn't previously reveal it.

Chosen_163.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_163.text: Been prying into my research, then? What a devious piece of flesh you are. Consider yourself lucky that I have use for you.
Chosen_163.context: NodeContext: Displeased, but willing to let it go for the sake of the mission.

Chosen_93.speaker: Player
Chosen_93.text: All right, I'll help you find this relic.
Chosen_93.context: InternalNodeContext: This question node if the player isn't aware of nightsong via Balthazar's research in MOO.

Chosen_166.speaker: Player
Chosen_166.text: What do you need of me?

Chosen_60.speaker: Player
Chosen_60.text: No, I just decided to kill you instead.

Chosen_260.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_260.text: Kill me? Death is my ally, fool.

Chosen_192.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_192.text: Not lost your nerve, I hope? I tend to remove those from my creations - too much fuss.

Chosen_228.speaker: Player
Chosen_228.text: I'll take that bell. It may prove useful.

Chosen_148.speaker: Player
Chosen_148.text: Balthazar - I heard of a monk by that name once. He died a long time ago.

Chosen_147.speaker: Player
Chosen_147.text: You could have warned me about the orthon that was lurking in this place.

Chosen_34.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_34.text: I could have, but decided not to - all the better for judging your mettle.

Chosen_136.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen_136.text: That caterwauling beast is irrelevant as far as I'm concerned - unless he hampers my goals. In that case, consider him a foe, and act accordingly.

GolemInvitation_0.speaker: Flesh
GolemInvitation_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The door to Balthazar's private chambers open, revealing a flesh golem. It utters a gurgle and beckons the player to enter.InternalNodeContext: Note - if the flesh golem is somehow unavailable, an alternate invitation will trigger with the necormancer instead.

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2_0.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2_0.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt, directed at a trespassing necromancer

Barricade_4.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_4.text: You prowl my battleground - why? Are you friend? Foe? Thieving scavenger?

Barricade_28.speaker: Narrator
Barricade_28.text: *You find yourself in a dead, putrid skull - somehow hosting a tadpole amongst a squirm of maggots. Another presence lurks within, manipulating the corpse like a puppet.*
Barricade_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld FX. The player winces at the pain of a mindmeld. The skeleton has no visible reaction.

Barricade_23.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_23.text: Ah. A friend - an uninvited friend. I did not request help.

Barricade_8.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_8.text: Z'rell sent me, looking for someone called Balthazar.
Barricade_8.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN only if Z'rell sent the player to look for Balthazar.

Barricade_11.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_11.text: Did she now? Enter - I will see if I have any use for you.

Barricade_5.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_5.text: Who am I really speaking to?

Barricade_2.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_2.text: Come join me and find out. I want to look at you with my own eyes.

Barricade_3.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_3.text: Stinking pile of ogre afterbirth! The quakes herald the shadows - they've found me!
Barricade_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: continues from a cinematic node in which a shadowquake interrupts the dialogue - the quake continues as background noise. If possible visualisation of dust falling might help to sell it.NodeContext: Sudden angry, alarmed outburst. There's an attack imminent

Barricade_9.text: I'm no friend of yours - whatever you are.

Barricade_31.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_31.text: Not a friend, perhaps, but an ally. Or a servant. I saw within you - we share common purpose.

Barricade_14.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_14.text: Hurry inside, or your racket is liable to -
Barricade_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skeleton on alert, weapon raised, glancing around at the environs while speaking to the playerNodeContext: On alert, urgent. Line is cut off as the skeleton notices something. (full line would have been 'liable to draw attention')

Barricade_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: A deep rumble rises from below. The surrounding ruins tremble as if experiencing an earthquake. Characters in the scene should react, with apprehension, but if possible a wider shot to emphasise the scale of the temple as the quake rumbles through it.

Barricade_1.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_1.text: Rancid donkey scrotum! The quakes herald the shadows - it's already too late!
Barricade_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: continues from a cinematic node in which a shadowquake interrupts the dialogue - the quake continues as background noise. If possible visualisation of dust falling might help to sell it.NodeContext: Sudden angry, alarmed outburst. There's an attack imminent

Barricade_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The rumbling of the shadowquake intensifies and reaches its peak. All the light sources in the vicinity are suddenly extinguished. Rifts tear open in the floor. Dark Justiciar wraiths emerge.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues after this node.

Barricade_21.speaker: Narrator
Barricade_21.text: *You feel a tremble rising from the floor, growing stronger...*
Barricade_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances around, sensing something

Barricade_22.speaker: Narrator
Barricade_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances around, sensing somethingInternalNodeContext: Intentionally empty - in the rare case a summon triggers this dialog we just want to show the Shadowquake cinematic. Empty Greeting node will be skipped

Barricade_38.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_38.text: My creations are my pride and joy. I shall kill you for attacking them.

Barricade_13.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_13.text: Afraid I'd ruin these things' looks? Make good on your threat, or else stand aside.

Barricade_29.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_29.text: Hot blood and bluster. But perhaps I can use you.

Barricade_0.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_0.text: These are masterworks. Perhaps you'll join their ranks, once I repurpose your corpse.

Barricade_30.text: A misunderstanding. Please, accept my apologies.

Barricade_32.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_32.text: I can do little with an apology. But you... I may have a use for you.
Barricade_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The skeleton looks the player up and down briefly, like an appraisal.

Barricade_6.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade_6.text: No. I will accept a gift from you instead. Raw materials.
Barricade_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The skeleton looks the player up and down briefly, like an appraisal.

AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts_0.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts_0.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt. MER-kul

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_1_0.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_1_0.text: Foul assemblage! You should never have come here!
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_1_0.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt (the subject of these taunts is himself a necromancer/possibly undead)

AD_OutsideRoom_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OutsideRoom_0.text: Come inside. Then we can talk.
AD_OutsideRoom_0.context: NodeContext: 'Not now' (returning to his room before he deigns to speak further)

AD_LowHP_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_LowHP_0.text: Fool. You think striking down my body will be the end of me?

Skeletons_0.text: Enough - my creations have nothing to say to you.
Skeletons_0.context: InternalNodeContext: This hasmet after the player has met the necromancer in his chambersNodeContext: Hint of annoyance

Skeletons_1.context: InternalNodeContext: This node after the shadowquake fight but before the player has met the necromancer in personNodeContext: Demanding

Skeletons_2.text: Enough dawdling - come to my inner chambers.
Skeletons_2.context: InternalNodeContext: This hasmet after the shadowquake fight but before the player has met the necromancer in personNodeContext: Impatient

Skeletons_3.text: Leave my creations be - they must focus on their duties.
Skeletons_3.context: InternalNodeContext: This node after the player has met the necromancer in his chambersNodeContext: Hint of annoyance

NecroInvitation_1.speaker: Balthazar
NecroInvitation_1.text: Forced to fight using my own flesh? How... unbecoming.
NecroInvitation_1.context: NodeContext: Peeved. He was forced to get his hands dirty in a fight due to the player shifting the course of battle in his direction.

NecroInvitation_0.speaker: Balthazar
NecroInvitation_0.text: Join me in my chambers. I would speak to you, before your blundering causes any more calamities.

AD_GolemGoesBerserk_0.speaker: Balthazar
AD_GolemGoesBerserk_0.text: Imbecile! You've knocked the wits out of him!
